title: Governance and Integration of Federal Mission Resilience

enrichment.summary: This executive order establishes a strategy and organizational framework to ensure that federal agencies can continue their essential functions without interruption during emergencies or threats. It creates a high-level committee to coordinate resilience efforts across the executive branch, emphasizing proactive risk management and continuity of government operations.
potential_concerns: The centralized Executive Committee structure may slow interagency responsiveness during emergencies, potentially impacting military personnel who rely on rapid federal mission continuity.

Emphasis on continuity of National Essential Functions could inadvertently deprioritize emerging threats or non-traditional risks, leaving intelligence community personnel exposed to evolving vulnerabilities.
The increased focus on proactive risk management might lead to expanded surveillance or security measures that could raise privacy concerns within agencies involved in homeland-security.
Budget constraints and appropriations dependency might limit effective implementation, undermining the resilience efforts intended to protect federal mission-critical operations.
